messageBody:
I have released an update to JUnitPerf which contains a couple of
subtle, yet important, design and usability improvements:

- Replaced the ThreadBarrier with a ThreadedTestGroup to
catch and handle uncaught exceptions thrown by threads
spawned by ThreadedTest. This improves thread safety
and enforces test atomicity.

- Added several variants of LoadTest constructors for
convenience and extensibility.

- Added a suite of JUnit tests to test JUnitPerf.

- Updated JUnitPerf.html and ExampleLoadTest.java to
include more examples for constructing LoadTests with
various constructors.

These changes should be completely transparent to current users of
JUnitPerf.

Many thanks to Ervin Varga for suggesting the use of a ThreadGroup and
his comprehensive review of JUnitPerf.

JUnitPerf can be downloaded from

http://www.clarkware.com/software/junitperf.zip

Any feedback you may have is most welcome!

Thanks!

Mike
